album.name: Dunstable Kite Festival
album.description: We headed off to the Dunstable Kite Festival (29 July 2001) and had a fun day. It was very hot, and the breeze was stronger, and more regular than at the Newbury festival a few weeks ago. The guy doing the announcing was very good, and explained what was happening in every demonstration/event, and gave us a real insight into why certain things were happening. For instance, during the buggying event he explained what size kite was being used, what buggy, why he was wearing a harness - this was really informative. All in all, we had a good day out.

image.caption: The view from the car park
image.description: This was our first view of the Dunstable Kite Festival, having just parked the car. Quite an impressive sight.

image.caption: The kite club's bases
image.description: All along the left edge of the arena, the various clubs/flyers had set up their bases, and had all their kites laid out in preparation for their chance to fly.

image.caption: A glider over the downs
image.description: The kite festival was held above the glider club, and so during the afternoon we got to watch quite a few gliders and hang-gliders floating back down to the club.

image.caption: One man and his buggy
image.description: There was a small buggy demonstration, and in this picture you can see both the buggy and the kite. The arena wasn't very large - being just 60 m x 50 m and so the conditions for buggying weren't great

image.caption: A concerned look on a buggier's face
image.description: The expression on his face is what I expect my expression looked like last week.

image.caption: Looking more in control
image.description: The kite was powerful enough to get some good speed up going down the hill, but coming back up proved more tricky. Apparently buggying isn't usually allowed on the downs, but they'd got permission for this demonstration.

image.caption: And on to mountain boarding
image.description: After having shown off on his buggy, the guy swapped onto a mountain board.

image.caption: Even the demonstrators have problems
image.description: Despite having done really well with the buggy, he claimed not to have had much practice with a board, and then he fell off.

image.caption: One of the larger kites at the festival
image.description: The pink octopus was one of the largest kites on display, and can be seen here with a ray below it (multicoloured) and a glider to it's right.

image.caption: Oops, the octopus got us
image.description: We flew our parastunter a little bit too close to the octopus, and got caught up in the Octopus's tentacles.

image.caption: Jane flying
image.description: Jane flying the parastunter, and trying to keep away from the Octopus...

image.caption: Sky candy
image.description: Lots of different kites, including the octopus, a gheko, a ray and many, many others.

image.caption: Our kite
image.description: Our parastunter, shortly before one of the lines snapped and we had to pack it away and take it home.

image.caption: Revolution's doing ballet
image.description: This demonstration was peformed to "The Frog Chorus"

image.caption: "We all stand together"
image.description: Actually, the bottom two kites were closer than they should have been and got tangled up together

image.caption: We all need friends to untangle us sometimes
image.description: Before the demonstration was over, two "ground helpers" helped to un-tangle two of the revolutions allowing the demonstration to continue.

image.caption: Almost sorted
image.description: And just about ready to get the revs back up flying in time to finish the demonstration as a team of 4 again.
